CARDINAL . GPE is not a part of GPE but a dependency of the ORG with its own government , legislature and courts and its own administrative , fiscal and legal systems . The ORG is ultimately responsible for the good government of the LOC and acts in this respect through ORG on the recommendation of Ministers of ORG in their capacity as ORG . In that capacity , the Home Secretary is charged with prime responsibility for Isle of Man affairs .

Prior to DATE , ORG regarded international treaties applicable to GPE as extending , in the absence of contrary provision , to GPE . Thereafter , they no longer so regarded such treaties unless there were an express inclusion and they treated the Island as a territory for whose international relations they were responsible . In fact , by letter dated DATE addressed to the Secretary - General of ORG , the Government of GPE declared , in accordance with LAW ) of the LAW , that the LAW should extend to a number of such territories , including LOC .

The LOC ’s parliament , ORG , is CARDINAL of the oldest in LOC . It consists of a Lieutenant - Governor appointed by and representing the ORG , an ORG ( ORG ) and a ORG ( the ORG of Keys ) . ORG legislates in domestic matters , the laws it adopts requiring ratification by ORG ; the Home Secretary is responsible for advising ORG whether or not to recommend that the Royal Assent be given .

In strict law , ORG has full power to pass laws applicable to GPE but , by constitutional convention , does not in the ordinary course legislate on the LOC ’s domestic affairs , such as penal policy , without its consent . This convention would be followed unless it were overridden by some other consideration , an example of which would be an international treaty obligation .
